DOC.brief_title: Soft Tissue Mobilization Versus Therapeutic Ultrasound Subjects With Neck Arm Pain
DOC.criteria: 1 . Active movement dysfunction could relate mechanical sensitivity neural structure upper limb . ( i.e . painful shoulder abduction elbow extension limit wrist extended wrist neutral . ) 2 . Positive response upper limb neural provocation test ( ULNT 1 ) ( see description detail ) 3 . Tenderness palpation cervical nerve trunk , brachial plexus , along median nerve . 4 . Tender point taut band muscle upper quadrant include scalenes , cervical paraspinals , trapezius , deltoid , pectoralis major minor , rotator cuff , biceps , triceps , coracobrachialis , brachialis , radiobrachialis , pronator teres , supinator , forearm extensor , forearm flexor , pronator quadratus , hand intrinsic muscle . 1 . Red flag note medical screen questionnaire tumor , fracture , history metabolic disease , prolonged history corticosteroid use . 2 . Signs central nervous system involvement hyperreflexia ( exaggerated response deep tendon reflex testing ) , unsteadiness gait , ataxia , disturbed vision , nystagmus , alter taste , positive Babinski 's Hoffman 's reflex . 3 . Cervical spine surgery within last 3 month . 4 . Litigation associate neck and/or upper limb pain . 5 . Insufficient English language skill complete questionnaire followup instruction . 6 . Inability complete treatment followup schedule . 7 . Current pregnancy .
